item.title: Hmm kinda need some help ova here
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

btw, with mine, replace all the “check*” like checkAdmin, checkMod etc etc, and put:

playerRights = getPlayerRights();

and in the player rights file (rights.txt) make sure you do (for rights)

like:

g0t-h4x 3
someone 2
someoneelse 1

etc etc etc

item.title: Hmm kinda need some help ova here
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

public int getPlayerRights() {
   try {
      BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader("./data/rights.txt"); // or wherever you save them
      String read = null;
      while((read = br.readLine() != null) {
            String[] tokens = read.split(" "); // split it up, format should be playerName rights
            if(playerName.equals(tokens[0]))  {
               return Integer.parseInt(tokens[1]);
            }
      }
   } catch(Exception e) {
      e.printStackTrace();
   }
   return 1; // or 0, whatever your playerRights is for normal player
}

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm kinda need some help ova here
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“sigex, post:2, topic:158518”]0 = basic player, 1 = mod, 2 = admin
3 is not a value!!!

every thing like that starts at the value of 0!

what server base are you using? its proberly because your server base is reading more then one char save and because your changing only one of the types the other is refreshing the changed type back to its orignal stat and if its testscape the other type is *.data witch idk what program or text editor is read in so you best bet is remove the other save and load from your client (and any left over int’s in player.java) and remove the extra char folder if your not that good at coding in java best bet is to get some one else to do this for you or switch to a better soruces…[/quote]

Wtf are you on about noob. You have no clue what your talking about yourself, so don’t post.

As for you saying 3 isn’t a value… /fail

item.description:
@sigex wrote:

0 = basic player, 1 = mod, 2 = admin
3 is not a value!!!

every thing like that starts at the value of 0!

what server base are you using? its proberly because your server base is reading more then one char save and because your changing only one of the types the other is refreshing the changed type back to its orignal stat and if its testscape the other type is *.data witch idk what program or text editor is read in so you best bet is remove the other save and load from your client (and any left over int’s in player.java) and remove the extra char folder if your not that good at coding in java best bet is to get some one else to do this for you or switch to a better soruces…

item.title: Hmm kinda need some help ova here
item.dc:creator: @g0t-h4x g0t-h4x
item.description:
@g0t-h4x wrote:

ok yo guys basicly my admin and mods are not working for me i go into character files and all that. but nope still not working and i was just wondering if this was the correct code
//start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = admin, 3 = owner

checkmods();
checkadmins();
checkstaff();
if(checkmods() == 5)
playerRights = 1;
if(checkadmins() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Gonna Wub”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“wh1p”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
playerRights = 2;
if(checkstaff() == 5 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“hahahahhah”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“h36h356h356h”))
playerRights = 2;

if not may somewone please post the correct one.
Thank-you much appreciated
